Class HiringTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • HiringTable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class HiringTable
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    The HiriningTable class stores an Array of Applicants and is responsible for handling anything that has to do with each Applicants such as, adding new Applicants into the HiringSystem, returning information about an specific Applicant, returning the number of Applicants in the system, displaying a nicely formatted table that contains each Applicants, and searching for a Applicants that contains certain qualities.

    It implements Cloneable in order to create a clone of itself

    • Constructor Detail

      • HiringTable

        public HiringTable()
        The default constructor of the HiringTable class. It initializes the applicants array to the maximum amount of Applicants in the table, and also sets the appliacntCounter to be 0

        Postcondition: The HiringTable has been initialized to an empty list of Applicants

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the amount of Applicants that is in the array

        Preconditions: The HiringTable has been instantiated

        Returns:
        Returns the number of Applicants that is in the array

      • addApplicant

        public void addApplicant(Applicant newApplicant)
                  throws FullTableException
        Adds the given Applicant into the applicants Array

        The Applicant object has been instantiated and the number of applicants in the HiringTable is less than MAX_APPLICANTS

        Postcondition: The new Applicant is now inserted at the end of the list

        Parameters:
        newApplicant - the given Applicant to be added into the applicants Array
        Throws:
        FullTableException - FullTableException is thrown if the applicants Array is at maximum capacity to indicate that there is no more spaces in the Array for the given Applicant

      • getApplicant

        public Applicant getApplicant(java.lang.String name)
                       throws ApplicantNotFoundException
        Fetch the Applicant that match the specified name in the applicants Array

        Precondition: The HiringTable object has been instantiated

        Parameters:
        name - The name to fetch in the applicants Array
        Returns:
        Returns the Applicant that have the matching name
        Throws:
        ApplicantNotFoundException - ApplicantNotFoundException is thrown to indicate that in the applicants Array there is no matching Applicants with the given name

      • getApplicantList

        public Applicant[] getApplicantList()
        The accessor method to get the applicants Array
        Returns:
        Returns the applicants Array that stores all the Applicants

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Creates a new reference to a HiringTable that have the same applicants Array and the same applicantCounter

        Preconditions: Method requires Applicant class to implement Cloneable

        Postconditions: A new reference to an HiringTable object with same applicants Array and the same applicantCounter

        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns a new reference to a HiringTable that have the same applicants Array and the same applicantCounter
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException - The CloneNotSupportedException is thrown if the object is not cloned successfully

      • printApplicantTable

        public void printApplicantTable()
        Print out a neatly formatted table of each item in the list

        Precondition: The HiringTable has been instantiated

        Postcondition: Displays a neatly formatted table of each Applicant from the HiringTable

      • removeApplicant

        public void removeApplicant(java.lang.String name)
                     throws ApplicantNotFoundException
        Remove the specified Applicant name from the applicants Array

        Precondition: The HiringTable has been instantiated

        Postcondition: The Applicant with the name given has been removed from the list. Any Applicant that was in a spot after the removed Applicant are shifted upwards one spot.

        Parameters:
        name - The Applicant name that needs to be removed from the applicants Array
        Throws:
        ApplicantNotFoundException - Indicates that the applicant with the given name was not found

      • refineSearch

        public static void refineSearch(HiringTable table,
                                java.lang.String company,
                                java.lang.String skill,
                                java.lang.String college,
                                double GPA)
        Filter out and find the Applicants that matches the different listed traits

        Precondition: The HiringTable object has been instantiated

        Postcondition: Display a neatly formatted table of each Applicant filtered from the HiringTable

        Parameters:
        table - The list of applicants to search in
        company - The company must be in the Applicant's application
        skill - The skill that must be in the Applicant's application
        college - The college that must be in the Applicant's application
        GPA - The minimum GPA that must be in the Application's application. It is set to 0 if the user didn't specify one
